questions.text: Which of the following is true about renal trauma? (LQ)

options.label: B
options.text: Exploration of the kidney to be done in all cases

options.label: C
options.text: Lumbar approach to kidney is preferred

questions.text: Which does not happen in unilateral renal trauma?

After RTA, a young male presented with non-pulsatile retroperitoneal hematoma. On table IVU was done. Right kidney was not visualized. Left kidney showed immediate excretion of dye. What is next step in the management?

options.label: B
options.text: Open Gerota`s fascia and explore proximal renal vessels

questions.correct_answer: B. Open Gerota`s fascia and explore proximal renal vessels

questions.text: In renal trauma, which statement is not correct? (LQ)

options.label: A
options.text: Exploration is indicated in 90% of cases

questions.correct_answer: A. Exploration is indicated in 90% of cases

questions.text: Absolute indication for surgical exploration after renal trauma? (LQ)

A 25 years old male presents to emergency with history of road traffic accident two hours ago. The patient is hemodynamically stable. Abdomen is soft. On catheterization of the bladder, hematuria is noticed. The next step in the management should be: (LQ)

options.label: D
options.text: Contrast enhanced computed tomography (CECT) of abdomen

questions.correct_answer: D. Contrast enhanced computed tomography (CECT) of abdomen

questions.text: First step in trauma: (LQ)
In surgical stress all hormone is increased except: (PG1 May 2015)
Early stage of trauma is characterized by: (LQ)
In case of clearing airway one of the following is not included: (AIIMS Nov 2015)
questions.explanation: Correct Answer (D)In case of clearing airway we do not include head lift

questions.text: Which one of the following veins should be avoided for intravenous infusion in the management of abdominal trauma? (LQ)
A female with suspected child abuse was brought to the casualty with severe bleeding from perineum. What should be the first line of management? (AIIMS Nov. 2014)

options.label: D
options.text: Inform police before starting the treatment

questions.text: Which one of the following is not a part of the Revised Trauma Score? (LQ)
Trauma and injury severity score (TRISS) includes: (LQ)
Mangled Extremity Severity Score (MESS) includes all of the following except? (AIIMS May 2015)
In triage green color indicates: (LQ)
Which colour of triage is given the highest priority? (AIIMS Nov 2013)
Most common organ involved in blunt injury to the abdomen: (LQ)
Investigation of choice for blunt trauma abdomen in unstable patient: (PGI Nov 2015)
Investigation of choice for diagnosing intra abdominal bleeding in a stable patient: (LQ)
A driver wearing seat belt applied brake suddenly to avoid accident. Most common organ injured in seat belt injury: (AllMS May 2013)
Preferred incision for abdominal exploration in blunt injury abdomen is (LQ)
Best diagnostic test in stable patient with blunt trauma abdomen is: (LQ)
FAST stands for (AIIMS Nov 2013)

options.label: A
options.text: Focused assessment with sonography for trauma

options.label: C
options.text: Fast assessment with sonography for trauma

options.label: D
options.text: Fast assignment with sonography and tomography (computed)

questions.correct_answer: A. Focused assessment with sonography for trauma

questions.text: A patient is brought to the emergency as a case of head injury, following a head on collision road traffic accident. His BP is 90/60 mmHg. Tachycardia is present. Most likely diagnosis is: (LQ)

A patient with abdominal injury presents to the emergency department with signs of signs of peritonitis and shock. Airway and breathing were secured and IV fluids were started with 2 large bore cannulas. The next line of management should be: (LQ)

options.label: C
options.text: Insertion of abdominal drain followed by laparotomy

questions.correct_answer: B. Exploratory laparotomy under general anesthesia

questions.text: Damage control surgery is: (AIIMS May 2013)

options.label: A
options.text: Minimal intervention done to stabilize the patient and do the definitive surgery later

options.label: B
options.text: Maximum possible surgical intervention is done immediately

options.label: D
options.text: Done to control damage during surgery

questions.correct_answer: A. Minimal intervention done to stabilize the patient and do the definitive surgery later

questions.text: Aims of abbreviated laparotomy: (LQ)
True about abdominal compartment syndrome:
Abdominal compartment syndrome is characterized by the following except (LQ)

options.label: B
options.text: Hypoxia due to increased peak inspiratory pressure

options.label: C
options.text: Hypotension due to decrease in venous return

questions.correct_answer: D. Oliguria due to ureter obstruction

questions.text: Organ most commonly damaged in penetrating injury of abdomen is: (AIIMS Nov 2015)
The probable cause of sudden death in a case superficial injury to neck is: (LQ)

options.label: B
options.text: Air embolism through external jugular vein

questions.correct_answer: B. Air embolism through external jugular vein

questions.text: A man comes to emergency with stab injury to left flank. He has stable vitals. What would be the next step in management(AIIMS Nov 2015)
In a blast injury, which of the following organ is least vulnerable to the blast wave? (AIIMS Nov 2015)

A 30-years old gentleman after sustaining road traffic accident present in emergency with BP 100/60 mmHg, Pulse 120 per min and CT scan shows splenic laceration at inferior border. after 2 units of blood transfusion, patients conditions are: BP 120/70 mmHg and pulse 84/min; the next line of management is: (PGI Nov 2015)

options.label: C
options.text: Continue the conservative treatment and take subsequent measures on monitoring the patient

questions.correct_answer: C. Continue the conservative treatment and take subsequent measures on monitoring the patient

questions.text: A child presents in causality in stable condition after a blunt abdominal trauma associated with splenic trauma. Treatment of choice is: (AIIMS Nov 2015)
True about blunt abdominal trauma with splenic rupture: (LQ)

options.label: B
options.text: Spleen is most common organ to be involved

options.label: C
options.text: For grade V injury treatment is conservative

questions.correct_answer: B. Spleen is most common organ to be involved

questions.text: Which of the following statements related to gastric injury is not true? (AllMS Nov 2015)

options.label: B
options.text: Treatment is simple debridement and suturing

options.label: C
options.text: Blood in stomach is always related to gastric injury

questions.correct_answer: C. Blood in stomach is always related to gastric injury

questions.text: A young patient presents with a massive injury to proximal duodenum, head of pancreas and distal common bile duct. Patient is H.stable. The procedure of choice in this patient should be: (LQ)

A 40-years old man brought to the emergency room with a stab injury to the chest. On examination patient is found to be hemodynamically stable. The neck veins are engorged and the heart sounds are muffled. The following statements are true for this patient except: (AIIMS Nov 2014)

options.label: A
options.text: Cardiac tamponade is likely to be present

options.label: B
options.text: Immediate emergency room thoracotomy should be done

options.label: C
options.text: Echocardiogram should be done to confirm pericardial blood

options.label: D
options.text: The entry wound should be sealed with an occlusive dressing

questions.correct_answer: B. Immediate emergency room thoracotomy should be done

questions.text: Sitaram a 40-years old man, met with an accident and comes to emergency department with engorged neck veins, rapid pulse and chest pain Diagnosis is:
A patient is brought to casualty with severe hypotension following a road traffic accident. No external injury is evident. The cause of hypotension is
Treatment of acutely developing massive left sided hemo-thorax in a young male after an accident is: (AIIMS Nov 13)

options.label: C
options.text: Endotracheal intubation + IPPV + pleural fluid aspiration

questions.text: Treatment of flail chest with respiratory distress
Best approach in thoracic trauma is: (LQ)
What is the treatment of choice in severe fail chest?

Steering wheel injury on chest of a young man reveals multiple fractures of ribs and paradoxical movement with severe respiratory distress. X-ray shows pulmonary contusion on right side without pneumothorax. What is the initial treatment of choice?
questions.correct_answer: B. Endotracheal intubation and mechanical ventilation

questions.text: True about flail chest are all except:(LQ)
Simple rib fracture should be treated with all except: (LQ)

options.label: A

options.label: C
options.text: Smaller tears heal spontaneously and surgery is not required

options.label: D
options.text: Abdominal approach is the most favoured

options.label: E
options.text: Mask ventilation is encouraged in patient with massive visceral herniation

options.label: B
options.text: Head injury due to wind screen

questions.text: Prognosis in head injury is best given by: (All India 2007, AIIMS Nov 2015)
A 20-years old male come to causality with head injury. Examination reveals normal consciousness and blood in the tympanic membrane. Most likely cause is: (LQ)
After head injury, biconvex, lenticular shape hematoma in CT scan is characteristic of which of the following: (LQ)
Which of the following is commonest source of extradural hemorrhage? (LQ)
A patient with sudden headache, vomiting and unconsciousness, diagnosis is: (LQ)
A patient presents in emergency with a cervical spine fracture. First thing to do is: (LQ)

options.label: A
options.text: Locate the fracture by shifting the patient side to side

options.label: C
options.text: Clear the airway and intubate him

questions.text: What will be the appropriate management of a patient with a clean wound over forearm with slight loss of tissue. he has received, tetanus toxoid 12 years back: (LQ)

options.label: C
options.text: Full dose of Human tetanus Ig

questions.correct_answer: B. Only one dose of TT

questions.text: Limb salvage can be done in all except: (LQ)

questions.correct_answer: C. Removal of fragments of bone

questions.text: When bullet is shot above pubic symphysis in midline directed backwards, first organ to get injuries is? (LQ)
In resection of muscle with history of trauma/crush injury, resection depends on: (PGI Nov 2015)
During reconstruction of an amputated limb which of the following is done first? (LQ)
Hypotension in acute spinal injury is due to: (LQ)
Due to decelerations, aorta can be ruptured at places where it is fixed except: (LQ)

options.text: Tendons should be repaired before nerves

options.label: B
options.text: Nerves should be repaired before tendons

options.text: Tendons should not be repaired at the same time

On examination, pulse -120/min, BP-80/50mmHg, breaths sounds were decreased on left side, JVP was raised and tympanic note was present on percussion. Pelvis and extremities were normal. What is your diagnosis?

A patient came to ER after RTA. He is conscious, could speak in single word sentences. RR-40/min and BP-70/40 mm Hg. What will be your next step?
questions.correct_answer: D. Needle insertion in 2nd IC space

questions.text: Young male presents with diarrhoea.Resident wants to give rapid fluids, which cannula should he choose:-
45yr old man with RTA, feeble pulse, and hypotension. All of the following are lines of management except.

options.label: B
options.text: Give tranexamic acid in initial hours

options.label: C
options.text: Give 2 liters of crystalloids fast as initial fluid

questions.correct_answer: C. Give 2 liters of crystalloids fast as initial fluid

questions.text: Patient presented to emergency after RTA with multiple rib fractures. He is conscious, speaking single words. On examination, respiratory rate was 40/min and BP was 90/40 mmHg. What is immediate next step?
questions.correct_answer: D. Insert Needle in 5th intercostal space

questions.text: Which of the following is seen in massive blood transfusion:

FAST stands for?
questions.correct_answer: B. Focussed assessment sonogram in trauma

questions.text: Which injury cannot be evaluated during eFAST?
In retroperitoneal haematomas . which one of the following statements is true ?

options.label: A
options.text: Penetrating trauma in pelvic region should be explored always

options.label: B
options.text: All zone 1 vascular injuries should be managed with embolization

options.label: C
options.text: Zone 2 penetrating injuries with expanding haematoma should be explored surgically

options.label: D
options.text: Mattox manoeuvre is when the ascending colon is mobilized to right to expose the aorta

questions.correct_answer: C. Zone 2 penetrating injuries with expanding haematoma should be explored surgically

questions.text: 26 year old man with RTA, complicated with pelvic fracture and is transfused blood. Within a few hours, patient developed fever , oliguria , hypotension. CVP is normal but there is bleeding from the site of IV line and through the ryles tube. What is the most common diagnosis ?
Which of the following is not a complication of massive transfusion
A male comes to emergency with RTA, Hypotension and dyspnea. Breath sound on right side is absent. CXR is shown above. What is the management of the patient?

options.label: D
options.text: Needle in 5th ICS followed by ICD placement.

questions.correct_answer: D. Needle in 5th ICS followed by ICD placement.

questions.text: What is additional benefit of e-FAST over conventional FAST?

options.label: C
options.text: Subdural and dural trauma can be identified

questions.correct_answer: B. Chest Trauma can be identified.

questions.text: Young male with RTA and poor GCS, was intubated, having normal NCCT, no cervical injury or pelvic fracture. FAST is negative. Likely Diagnosis is?
Triage means

Not included in Damage control surgery is?
An old lady fell down and presented after few days with headache and neurological symptoms. What is the source of bleeding?
Sequence of arrangement of following in RTA is? A. Cervical spine stabilization B. Intubation C. IV cannula D. Vital measurements
Which vaccine is not given after splenectomy?
Not a Boundary of triangle of safety?

A 35-year-old male sustained a head injury following a motorcycle accident. He experienced a brief loss of consciousness at the scene. Upon regaining consciousness, he developed severe headache and began to feel drowsy. A CT scan of the head is performed. Which of the following should be the management for this patient?
Which of the following is not done in primary survey of trauma?

A 32-year-old male presents to the emergency department after sustaining a stab wound to the left side of his chest. He is in acute distress, with a heart rate of 120 beats per minute, blood pressure of 90/60 mmHg, and respiratory rate of 28 breaths per minute. On physical examination, there is decreased breath sounds on the right side. A chest X-ray is shown below. What is the diagnosis?
Which needs immediate intervention in the triage?
A 25 years old male came to emergency department due to trauma hypotension, specific blood group not known. What to transfuse?
25 years old man with fall from 2nd floor of building comes to emergency, which of the following is not a part of primary survey in Trauma.
CHEST TRAUMA WITH MULTIPLE RIB FRACTURE 3-8, FOR PAIN MANAGEMENT-
Young male with head trauma comes to casualty. His GCS is 8/15 and SBP 90mmhg. There is absent breath sounds on right side. What is next step in management

options.label: A
options.text: A. Secure Airway, insert ICD, IV fluids.

questions.correct_answer: A. A. Secure Airway, insert ICD, IV fluids.

questions.text: A 30-year-old male in the emergency room requires rapid fluid resuscitation due to hypovolemic shock. Which of the following intravenous cannula gauges is most appropriate for this purpose?
What is the approximate flow rate of fluids through a 20G intravenous cann ula under normal conditions?

A 25-year-old male involved in a high-speed motor vehicle collision is brought to the emergency department with suspected spinal trauma. During the primary survey, the log roll maneuver is performed. Which of the following is the primary purpose of the log roll method in trauma management?

options.label: B
options.text: To check for spinal tenderness and examine the posterior surface

options.label: C
options.text: To facilitate insertion of a urinary catheter

options.label: D
options.text: To reposition the patient for airway management

questions.correct_answer: B. To check for spinal tenderness and examine the posterior surface

questions.text: A 45-year-old male with severe trauma is receiving a massive blood transfusion. Which of the following is a key component of the massive transfusion protocol (MTP)?

options.label: A
options.text: 1:1:1 ratio of packed red blood cells (PRBCs), plasma, and platelets

options.label: C
options.text: Administration of PRBCs alone until coagulation parameters normalize

options.label: D
options.text: Avoidance of tranexamic acid to prevent hypercoagulability

questions.correct_answer: A. 1:1:1 ratio of packed red blood cells (PRBCs), plasma, and platelets

questions.text: Which of the following is a common complication of massive blood transfusion?

A 40-year-old male is brought to the emergency department after a road traffic accident. He opens his eyes only in response to pain, makes incomprehensible sounds, and withdraws to painful stimuli. What is his Glasgow Coma Scale (GCS) score?
A 65-year-old male recovering from a stroke has the following responses: opens eyes spontaneously, speaks confused sentences, and localizes pain. What is his GCS score?

A 45-year-old male presents to the emergency department following a stab wound to the chest. On examination, he has hypotension, distended neck veins, and muffled heart sounds. Which of the following conditions is most likely?
Which of the following investigations is most sensitive for diagnosing cardiac tamponade?

A 50-year-old male presents to the emergency department with a pneumothorax requiring chest tube insertion. The appropriate site for tube placement is the "triangle of safety." Which of the following structures define the boundaries of this triangle?

options.label: A
options.text: Anterior border of pectoralis major, lateral border of trapezius, and 4th intercostal space

options.label: B
options.text: Anterior border of pectoralis major, lateral border of latissimus dorsi, and a line superior to the nipple

options.label: C
options.text: Medial border of pectoralis minor, lateral border of serratus anterior, and the diaphragm

options.label: D
options.text: Anterior axillary line, posterior axillary line, and the 6th rib

questions.correct_answer: B. Anterior border of pectoralis major, lateral border of latissimus dorsi, and a line superior to the nipple

questions.text: A patient with a large pneumothorax requires chest tube placement. Which intercostal space is most commonly targeted within the triangle of safety?

A 35-year-old male presents to the emergency department after a blunt chest trauma. A bedside ultrasound is performed to evaluate for pneumothorax. Which of the following ultrasound findings is most indicative of a pneumothorax?
questions.correct_answer: B. Barcode sign (stratosphere sign) on M-mode

questions.text: In a patient with a suspected pneumothorax, which of the following ultrasound signs confirms the diagnosis?

A 28-year-old male presents to the emergency department following a motor vehicle accident. He has midface swelling, ecchymosis, and mobility of the upper jaw. On examination, the patient has a fracture involving the maxilla, nasal bridge, and extending through the zygomatic arches. Which type of Le Fort fracture does this most likely represent?
Which of the following signs is most commonly associated with a Le Fort II fracture?

options.label: B
options.text: Diplopia due to orbital floor involvement

questions.correct_answer: B. Diplopia due to orbital floor involvement

questions.text: A 30-year-old male presents to the emergency department after a physical altercation. He reports pain and difficulty opening his mouth. On examination, there is malocclusion and tenderness over the left angle of the mandible. Which of the following is the most common site of mandible fracture?
Which of the following investigations is most appropriate to confirm a mandibular fracture?

options.label: B
options.text: Non-contrast CT scan of the face

questions.text: A 45-year-old male presents to the emergency department following a motor vehicle accident. He has signs of hemorrhagic shock (blood pressure: 70/40 mmHg, heart rate: 130 bpm) and a distended abdomen. A focused assessment with sonography for trauma (FAST) reveals free fluid in the abdomen. He is taken to the operating room for damage control surgery (DCS). Which of the following is NOT a component of DCS?
questions.correct_answer: B. Definitive repair of all injuries

questions.text: A 28-year-old male is brought to the emergency room after a gunshot wound to the abdomen. On arrival, he is hypotensive (BP 60/30 mmHg), tachycardic (HR 140 bpm), and hypothermic (34°C). Which of the following findings during laparotomy would indicate the need for damage control surgery rather than definitive surgical repair?

A patient with blunt abdominal trauma is undergoing surgery. To expose the entire retroperitoneum and major vessels on the right side, the surgeon performs the Cattell-Braasch maneuver. What is the key step in this procedure?

options.label: B
options.text: Mobilizing the hepatic flexure and duodenum

questions.correct_answer: B. Mobilizing the hepatic flexure and duodenum
